item.title: US, Iran set for nuclear talks in Geneva
item.description: The US and Iran hold indirect talks in Geneva on Tuesday aimed at resolving their long-running nuclear dispute, with little clear indication of compromise as Washington masses a battle force in the region. US envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner will take part in the negotiations, which are bein

item.title: Jamaat, NCP threaten oath boycott
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami and its alliance partner the National Citizen Party (NCP) have threatened to boycott the swearing-in ceremony for lawmakers after the BNP declined to take oath as members of the Constitution Reform Council. Although BNP lawmakers were sworn in as members of the 13th National Parlia

item.title: BNP MPs opt against duty-free cars, government plots
item.description: BNP lawmakers have decided not to accept duty-free cars or government plots after taking oath as members of the 13th national parliament. The decision was taken on Tuesday during the party’s first parliamentary meeting following the swearing-in ceremony, according BNP Media Cell member Shair

item.title: Tarique Rahman elected parliamentary party leader
item.description: BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman has been elected as the leader of the parliamentary party. He was elected parliamentary party leader in a meeting of BNP’s parliamentary party at the meeting room in Jatiya Sangsad Bhaban at about 11.30 am on Tuesday, BNP media cell member Shairul Kabir Khan told

item.title: Expatriate’s wife, two children found dead in Cumilla
item.description: Police recovered the bodies of a woman and two children with their throats slit at Uttar Manipur village in Homna upazila of Cumilla early Tuesday. The deceased were identified as Sukhi Akter, wife of Saudi Arabia expatriate Zahirul Islam, their four-year-old son Hossain and six-year-old Zobaid, s

item.title: Jamaat MPs take oath
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami lawmakers have taken their oath as members of the 13th national parliament, despite earlier threatening to boycott the ceremony after the BNP declined to be sworn in as members of the Constitution Reform Council. Jamaat MPs and independents began taking the oath shortly after noon

item.title: Dhaka Metro Rail unveils updated train timings for Ramadan
item.description: The Dhaka Mass Transit Company Limited (DMTCL) has introduced a fresh Metro Rail timetable for the holy month of Ramadan. According to a notice on Tuesday, the updated timetable will remain in effect from the first day of Ramadan until the day before Eid-ul-Fitr, adjusting train timings in line wi

item.title: Tarique taps ex-state minister Milon for cabinet
item.description: ANM Ehsanul Hoque Milon, the BNP MP from Chandpur-1 and a former state minister for education, has been invited to join the cabinet of the incoming government led by Tarique Rahman. Milon’s personal aide, MA Foyez, confirmed the development on Tuesday. “The cabinet secretary called a

item.title: UK Minister Seema to attend Bangladesh govt’s swearing-in ceremony
item.description: British Minister Seema Malhotra will attend the swearing-in ceremony of the newly elected government of Bangladesh later today. She paid a courtesy call on Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus at the State Guest House Jamuna on Tuesday. British High Commissioner to Bangladesh Sarah Cooke and Senior

item.title: Gold price drops by Tk 2,216 per bhori in Bangladesh
item.description: The price of gold in Bangladesh has been reduced by Tk 2,216 per bhori, with the new rate for 22-carat gold set at Tk 258,824 per bhori (11.664 grams), Bangladesh Jewellers Association (BAJUS) announced on Tuesday. In a morning notification, BAJUS said the price of pure gold (tejabi gold) declined

item.title: Air Chief calls on CA
item.description: Air Chief Marshal Hasan Mahmood Khan paid a courtesy call on Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus at the State Guest House Jamuna in Dhaka on Tuesday said the Chief Adviser’s Press Wing.

item.title: Tarique’s first cabinet: Who makes the cut?
item.description: BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir, Standing Committee members Salahuddin Ahmed and Iqbal Hasan Mahmud, and several other leaders have received calls to take oath as members of the cabinet in the incoming government led by Tarique Rahman.
